page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY OF MOBBERLEY. {HISTORY OF MOBBERLEY. Mobberley got its name from the Anglo- Saxon words 'Mot' meaning a meeting, 'Burgh' meaning a town or village, and 'Lege', an open tract of country - 'Motburghlege'. And this was its name in the original DOMESDAY BOOK. The history of Mobberley is closely linked with the land which was at one time part of a huge forest. Mobberley Brook divides the area into land types - in the south the land is largely sand whereas in the north clay predominates. There are also large deposits of salt, peat, marl, running sand and silver sand and there are also underground streams which cause the land to be unstable. {LOCAL INDUSTRIES. Mostly, the area was served by small Industries which served local needs.
